definition: commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)

sentences.english: The Company is a Taiwanese-owned trading companies, products for export.
sentences.chinese: 本公司是一台商独资贸易公司，产品全部外销。

sentences.english: Statistics also revealed that Taiwanese business investments in the mainland is tending to increase.
sentences.chinese: 统计还显示，台商投资祖国大陆正趋向大型化。

definition: variant of 臺灣|台湾[Tai2 wan1]
PRC state council office for Taiwan affairs, abbr. for 國務院台灣事務辦公室|国务院台湾事务办公室[Guo2 wu4 yuan4 Tai2 wan1 Shi4 wu4 Ban4 gong1 shi4]
Nantou city and county in central Taiwan
Mainland Affairs Council (Taiwan), abbr. for 大陸委員會|大陆委员会
Ko Wen-je (1959-), Taiwanese independent politician, Mayor of Taipei City from 2014
DPP (Democratic Progressive Party, Taiwan)/abbr. for 民主進步黨|民主进步党
Cross-Strait Service Trade Agreement/abbr. for 兩岸服務貿易協議|两岸服务贸易协议[Liang3 an4 Fu2 wu4 Mao4 yi4 Xie2 yi4]
abbr. for 立法委員會|立法委员会[li4 fa3 wei3 yuan2 hui4]/abbr. for 立法委員|立法委员[li4 fa3 wei3 yuan2]
(Tw) tourist from mainland China/illegal immigrant from mainland China
Ma Ying-jeou (1950-), Taiwanese Kuomintang politician, Mayor of Taipei 1998-2006, president of Republic of China 2008-2016
